title: Wildfires scorch Greek countryside amid record temperatures in Europe
description: Wildfires are burning the Greek countryside as Europe sizzles under some of the hottest temperatures ever recorded. NBC News’ Josh Lederman has more details on the impact of the severe weather on the residents.

title: Matty Healy slams Malaysia's anti-LGBTQ laws and kisses bassist onstage in Kuala Lumpur
description: The 1975 frontman Matty Healy had some choice words for the Malaysian government pertaining to its extreme anti-LGBTQ laws while performing in the country’s capital city, Kuala Lumpur.

title: Biden gives Mexico a year to better protect these endangered marine animals
description: President Joe Biden sent a letter to Congress outlining steps to urge Mexico step up protection of the endangered vaquita porpoise and totoaba fish.

title: Israel's military assessing reservists’ protest letter over judicial overhaul
description: Israel’s military said on Friday it was examining the impact of a letter sent by air force reservists who threatened to stop volunteering for service if the government goes ahead with a planned judicial overhaul.

title: Flag belonging to a Japanese soldier killed during World War II repatriated during Texas ceremony
description: A flag carried by a Japanese soldier killed in action during World War II was handed over Thursday by the USS Lexington Museum in Texas to a nonprofit organization for return to the man’s family.

title: Prominent Russian hard-liner who accused Putin of weakness in Ukraine is detained
description: A prominent Russian hard-liner who accused President Vladimir Putin of weakness and indecision in Ukraine was detained Friday on charges of extremism.

title: No lion: Big cat that triggered huge police search in Germany was probably a wild boar
description: A huge police operation to find a lioness on the loose near Berlin encountered a problem Friday: there is no lion.

title: Mexican president's verbal attacks on female political rival raise her profile
description: Mexican Pres. Andrés Manuel López Obrador’s verbal attacks on charismatic opposition rival Sen. Xochitl Galvez have raised her profile and could undermine his party.

title: North Korea silent on Travis King as U.S. Army launches investigation
description: The U.S. Army has launched an investigation into Travis King after he fled into North Korea while on a tour of the DMZ as North Korea stays silent on the soldier’s crossing. NBC News’ Matt Bradley reports from South Korea.

title: Europe struggles under record-breaking heat wave
description: Europe is experiencing record-breaking temperatures as a heat wave grips much of the continent, leaving locals and tourists struggling to find relief from the heat. NBC News’ Josh Lederman reports from Mandra, Greece.

title: Close call: Watch lucky woman narrowly avoid car collision
description: A woman crossing a busy street in Argentina had a close call when two cars collided in front of her. The two vehicles veered off in opposite directions leaving the woman safely in the middle.

title: Team USA to begin Women’s World Cup title defense in New Zealand
description: Anticipation in New Zealand is growing as Team USA is set to begin their World Cup title defense against Vietnam in Auckland. NBC News’ Molly Hunter has the details.

title: North Korea escalates nuclear rhetoric but remains silent on detained U.S. soldier
description: North Korea has escalated its fiery rhetoric over its threatened use of nuclear weapons, days after a U.S. soldier was taken into custody for crossing the border from South Korea.

title: Sunak’s Conservatives suffer 2 big defeats but avoid a wipeout in trio of U.K. special elections
description: LONDON — Britain’s governing Conservative Party suffered two thumping defeats Friday in a trio of special elections but avoided a drubbing after holding onto former premier Boris Johnson's seat in suburban London.

title: Indian rescuers look for landslide survivors as dozens are feared trapped
description: A landslide triggered by torrential rains in India's western Maharashtra state killed at least 10 people, with many others feared trapped under piles of debris. State officials said 60 rescuers and trained trekkers along with sniffer dogs have been deployed to help save people trapped by the landslide.

title: India’s Modi publicly condemns assault on women amid ongoing ethnic violence
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi broke his public silence over ethnic clashes in India’s northeast after a video that went viral showed two women being assaulted by a mob. Dozens of people have been killed and more than 40,000 have fled their homes since clashes broke out between Christian Kukis and mostly Hindu Meiteis in Manipur earlier this year.

title: India’s Modi breaks silence on ethnic violence in Manipur after video shows women being paraded naked
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi broke his public silence over deadly ethnic clashes in India's Manipur state, saying the assaults of two women were unforgivable.

title: China-linked hackers accessed email of U.S. ambassador, officials say
description: WASHINGTON — China-linked hackers accessed the email account of U.S Ambassador to China Nicholas Burns as part of a recent targeted intelligence-gathering campaign, two U.S. officials familiar with the matter confirmed to NBC News.

title: How South American soccer programs are helping bridge gender gap
description: Telemundo’s Nicole Suarez reports on how soccer programs in South America are helping to train young girls from impoverished areas to be able to compete at a professional level.
